dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tooth fairy, if we weren't in a public place right now, your teeth would be so far down your throat you'd be usin' your ass to chew food. The Man's eyes go wide as he backs off. Ron turns back to table, takes a few pamphlets. Titles include: "POPPERS ST POSSIBLE CAUSE OF AIDS"; "AZT SHOWS SIGNS OF PROMISE". Ro drifts toward the front, where the CROWD is getting hosti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long before AZT is approved? Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 19

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FDA standard procedure to approve a new drug is eight to twelve years -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're dying here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are looking to fast track --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need it now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're working closely with the FDA to make sure every effort is made--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell, if it works even a little, we'll take the chance! General shouts of agreement from the CROWD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's both our job and the FDA's to make sure the drug is safe -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true you can get it in Mexico?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about dextran sulfate?! As the chaos and shouting continues, Ron walks out in frustration and we're suddenly--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON -- a line of flickering CANDLES. That's Ron's POV as he grimaces, despair in his eyes. He doesn't look at the moving, out-of-focus SILHOUETTES in f of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mumbles to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to slow it down a second, catch my breath. I'm not ready to crawl into a corner. You hear that? I'm not fucking ready. Man, if you're up there you better be listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 19

dialogues.speaker: RON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And if there's a chance, if I got one fucking chance, send me a sign. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 20 Ron downs a shooter and grimaces again. He slams the glas down on a table among empty glasses and looks up at the candles on a stage in front of a STRIPPER, lost in his thoughts. Then he looks up and sees something across the room, past the stripper. She tries to get his attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're not gonna look or buy a dance, you could at least tip me. Ron stands and throws some bills on the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take a dance, but not fer me. Just shake it, he'll see you. Ron looks heavenward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. And he walks off towards a man at the end of the bar: the Hispanic Orderly from the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cowboy boots nervously play with a McDonald's Bag on the ground next to a garbage dumpster. They stop when the Hispanic Orderly walks out of the hospital. He gets to th dumpster, throws a BROWN PAPER BAG in it, picks up the McDonald's bag, looks inside and leaves without a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron sits at the table, removes a box of pills from the ba labeled AZT, FOR RESEARCH PURPOSES ONLY. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 21 Ron removes a pill, decides two is better, washes them do with a beer, and sniffs a line of coke. Looks at his reflection in the turned-off T.V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ron pulls up to his jobs site in his battered '73 Linc he spots T.J., Clint and a half dozen other WORKERS throu the windshield, all staring at him menacingly. Before Ron gets out, the Foreman emerges through the crowd. Without word, the guy just slowly shakes his head. Ron gives him finger and drives off, popping a few more AZT pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hispanic Orderly throws a BROWN PAPER BAG in the dump picks up a fast food bag, and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty; closed for the day. Ron sits in the empty bleacher sweaty and shivering; he looks horrible, maybe disoriente He pops a pill of AZT and drinks from a bottle of Tequila

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A labyrinth of identical trailers. Ron wanders, searching his own. Confused, he changes direction and continues to his way down the different rows. He stops in front of one and stares at the door where two YOUNG BOYS are seated on the steps, staring back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell you doin' here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waves them aside. As he walks up the steps, his neighb BUCKY and his WIFE stare at him blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you doin' in my house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron doesn't realize that he's not at his place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting on an examining table, meet RAYON, a cross-dresse his early 30s, in long eyelashes, earrings, painted nails a pink scarf tied around a full brown curly wig. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 21

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (reviewing a chart) You missed your last trial appointment. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 22

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like this blouse?   Cause I think the neckline's too low. Eve leans against the sink, annoyed.   She pulls her mask

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayon, the whole point of this study is to determine whether AZT is helping people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Evie, you know there ain't no helpin' me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't mean I'm going to stop trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you so good to me? Rayon watches Eve for a while, with affection. He grabs h and holds on to her. These two seem to have a history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A steady drizzle. Ron stands out by the dumpster, his boo and cowboy hat soaked. The Hispanic Orderly emerges from hospital, a large garbage bag in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There ain't no more, they started lockin' it up. The Orderly throws the garbage into the dumpster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got more cash. The Orderly studies Ron who holds out some money. The Ord snatches it, and writes something on a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.   In Mexico. A doctor, he has some. Ron takes the paper, looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is this bullshit? Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 23 Ron takes a swing at the Orderly but misses. Something ab Ron is off. We hear the ringing sound again. Ron struggle to stand and collapses onto the ground. Black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Woodroof?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron lays in bed asleep, an I.V. tube hooked up to his arm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron's eyes slowly peel open. Eve is hovering over him, a surgical mask on her face. As he looks at her, a faint sm passes his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve frowns, didn't expect that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron blinks.   Clears the fantasy.    His eyes scan the ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You almost died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure that didn't surprise anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve seems to smile behind her mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that a smile? Eve You've had a blood transfusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Sevard steps forward. Dr. Sevard Mr. Woodroof I'm doctor Sevard. Ron I remember you. Dr. Sevard I need you to tell me where you obtained AZT from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 23 RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who said I was on AZT? DR. SEVARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dealing in pharmaceutical drugs is illegal. Ron

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about. Dr. Sevard shakes his head and walks out. EVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get some rest. She follows Sevard out of the room. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.   We were just gettin' somewhere. RAYON (O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, you don't have the slightest chance. Ron turns and sees the hospital curtain being pulled by t PATIENT in the next bed -- it's Rayon. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 24

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Rayon. Rayon gets up and goes over to Ron's bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, fuck you and go back to your bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, I don't bite. Rayon looks Ron over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you're handsome in a Texas hick, white trash, dumb, kinda way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck outta here, whatever you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sticks and stones, cowboy. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna play cards?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (perking up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got cash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron sits cross-legged on his bed across from Rayon, who h pile of cash before him. As they lay their cards down:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full house. Jacks over threes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'da figured you for queens. Cleaned out, Ron tosses his cards; Rayon scoops up the mo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry darlin'. As Ron starts to unfold his legs, he suddenly SCREAMS in grabbing his calf. Rayon grabs his leg, presses his finge deep into the muscle and massages. Ron contorts in pain, grips the side of the bed. Rayon goes deeper. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 25

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breath.   Relax. Ron breaths.    Finally the pain subsides and Ron is left

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, drink some water. Rayon HOLDS the cup so Ron can drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta stay hydrated or your muscles will cramp. Rayon starts to massage Ron's other foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got nice feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, I'm straight, OK! Rayon leaves Ron alone.    An awkward beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the fuck you in here anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AZT trial. My friend is paying me to split my dose with him. That way we'll both get some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much is he paying you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five grand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I coulda charged him twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about me? Will you sell me some?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, sweetie. I made a deal. We HEAR someone speaking loud in the hallway, in Spanish. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 26

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you keep it down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve spots Ron, back in his clothes, walking towards the e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Woodroof! Ron stops, turns to see Eve approaching wit Nurse Frazin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I signed myself out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too sick to leave here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The worst-case scenario bein' what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can keep you comfortable at least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, but I prefer to die with my boots on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As your doctor, I cannot recommend you to do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well as my doctor, can you get me some damn AZT? Eve just looks at him.   She can't.   Ron takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron emerges from his Lincoln, approaches his trailer. Sto in his tracks at the EVICTION NOTICE taped to his padlock door, over which someone has spray-painted: FAGGOT BLOOD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still live here, you hear me?!    I fuckin' live here!! Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 27 He looks around, eyes wild, heart racing... but there's n there to hear him. After a beat, he crosses to his car, p the trunk. Grabs a single-barreled Winchester SHOTGUN lyi within it. He checks the CHAMBER, spins the gun, does a f maneuvers, the barrel pointing at his head. He pumps it, in a flash levels it and BLASTS the lock off his trailer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron enters, and desperately looks around for something, anything to take with him. He finds HIDDEN CASH in a Pats Cline Crazy cassette box. A duffel bag on the shoulder, he grabs the TEXAS WILDFLOW PAINTING off the wall and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron starts the engine and drives to the two Kids from ear looking on curiously. Ron gives them a handful of candies stole from the hospital, and nods toward his trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have fun, kids.     It's all yours. And with that, he pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron cruises... feeling as good as he looks. He pulls the over. Sits there in silence. Breathes in. Looks over at h stuff on the back seat, and then at his gun lying next to He grips the steering wheel... and starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron's Lincoln rolls down the crowded, impoverished street

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron in the grips of PNEUMONIA, studies a hand drawn map o city streets. His hands shake, his skin burns with fever. Ron turns down a small side street, stops in front of a nondescript, WHITEWASHED door. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 27

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron enters, blind-sided by the mayhem inside. Boxes of dr and hospital supplies lie in various stages of unpacking. INTERPRETER shouts above the din to his wealthy ASIAN CLI Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 28 DR. VASS (50's), fit but tired, shouts in Spanish to a MA unloading boxes. He effortlessly switches to Japanese, continues to shout to another worker. Dr. Vass sees Ron, quickly moves over to him. DR. VASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have something for me to sign? RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm lookin' for Dr. Vass. Dr. Vass steps over. DR. VASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak up. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm lookin' for Vass, for some AZT. DR. VASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking to poison yourself? He grabs an empty bottle of pills on the counter.   Throw to Ron. DR. VASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's from the chemical manufacturer who makes AZT, Sigma. Ron looks at the bottle labeled with skull and crossbones HIGHLY TOXIC, NOT FOR HUMAN CONSUMPTION. DR. VASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First thing I tell my patients: you won't find that shit here! Ron looks confused. A nearby stack of boxes tumbles over. Dr. Vass shouts to no one in particular. VASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who stacked those boxes there? (to Ron) Check in with a nurse. Dr. Vass is off, ripping open boxes. Ron starts to cough again.   Badly.   Vass notices, and s something in Spanish. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 29

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frail and weak, Ron lies on a cot, surrounded by a dozen PATIENTS of varied nationalities. A NURSE records his vit signs in a chart, then hands it off to Dr. Vass, who peru the information and begins reading aloud:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocaine, alcohol, methamphetamine, AZT. (to Ron) That's what I call a recipe for disaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around) Doc, this place is a shit-hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who said I was a Doctor? They revoked my license to practice three years ago, that's why I'm down in this shit-hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?   What'd you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't play ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These drugs you're doing, they're breaking down your immune system, making you susceptible to infections.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So cocaine gave me pneumonia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocaine made you more susceptible. As did AZT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought AZT's supposed to help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only people AZT helps are the people who sell it. (beat) It kills every cell it comes in contact with, good and bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So medically speakin', I kicked my own ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 30

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods as he writes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm prescribing a regimen of vitamins as well as the mineral zinc to build your immune system back up. You'll also be taking Aloe and essential fatty acids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In gloves and surgical masks, Eve looks on Nurse Frazin w drawing blood from Rayon's arm, five other AIDS PATIENTS nearby. That done, the Nurse dispenses meds, giving each patient a paper pill cup marked with a different NUMBER. Rayon takes his pill, winces; Eve makes a mental note, th walks down the line of patients, touching each of them. S comes to Rayon, gives his shoulder a squeeze, then exits.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK. SUPER
dialogues.text: Six months Later

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Medical journals everywhere; on the wall are rows of entomology, various butterflies encased in GLASS. A healt Ron sits across from Dr. Vass who reads his test results.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better.   Your T-Cell count's improving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I still positive for HIV?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll always test positive for HIV, and now, you have AIDS, due the toxic shit you've been pumping into your body, all the drugs, plus the AZT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 31

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shot your immune system. Now you have chronic pneumonia, among other things. It can cause memory loss, mood swings, aching joints...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it sucks, I got it. Dr. Vass smiles and holds up a bottle in each hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is DDC, it works as an anti viral similar to AZT but less toxic. And this is Peptide T, it's a protein -- totally non-toxic. Early studies have shown it can help with all of that. This is what I had you on since you got here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you can't buy them back in the U.S.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not approved. Ron takes the bottle of PEPTIDE T, turns it over in his h looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chinks, homos and herbs, you got a new world order here, Vass. You could be makin' a fortune off this stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron stares into the trunk of his Lincoln Convertible. VARIOUS BOXES filled with illegal meds are packed to the It won't close. Ron slams it shut. Dr. Vass emerges from the building. He hands Ron a neatly folded black vest, black pants and a detachable clerical collar on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you get caught, don't tell them you got AIDS. They'll never let you back in. You've got thirty days to get your ass back down here and pay me the other half, after that I send MIGUEL. Ron nods to Miguel, hops in his car, starts it, nods to V and takes off. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 32

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron's convertible races along the asphalt road. Hot deser sun. Sand and dirt cake the rims and tires. The car slows down and comes to a stop on the side of the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BINOCULARS POV on CARS making their way across the MEXICAN/AMERICAN BORDER. Ron puts down the binoculars and writes on a NOTEBOOK. A crude drawing of the border. He marks different lanes, studies it, looking for patterns. Ron throws the pen down and exits the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ron goes to get out of the car he is pulled back by a PLASTIC TUBE attached to his ARM. We follow it up to a shirt HOOK on the passenger side. An I.V. BAG hangs carelessly from the hook, a liquid flow INTRAVENOUSLY into Ron's arm. He reaches in and grabs the bag off the hook, gets out of car, holds the bag above his shoulder and takes a PISS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron now wears a PRIEST UNIFORM.   He hands the BORDER AGE passport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything to declare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nada. The Border Agent takes him in a moment, his outfit, the c the frame of the trunk almost touching the wheel and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron sits behind a table when a MAN in a suit walks in. takes off his jacket and sits. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 32 RICHARD BARKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Richard Barkley from the Food and Drug Administration office. Ron nods.   A beat. RICHARD BARKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a priest? Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 33 Ron smiles.   The customs agent doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have over 2,000 pills here. You are only allowed to bring in a ninety day supply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well as I told the gentlemen, I am a sick man. I have cancer. I take 22 pills a day and these here vials of Vitamin A, C, E and Zinc. That there is ninety days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man looks at Ron, not really buying it. He takes a bo of Peptide T and looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitamins? (no answer from Ron) You do realize that importing unapproved drugs for sale is a very serious offense?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, as I said, they're not for sale. And they ain't illegal, just "unapproved."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat; they stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we find the slightest indication that you're selling these drugs for profit, you will be thrown in jail... Father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I promise to take each and every one of them pills myself. In fact this present detainment has already put me off schedule... Son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron talks to Nurse Frazin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for Dr. Eve Saks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not here today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nurse Frazin leaves. Ron looks over the counter, sees something, looks around... Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 33

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfectly ordered and spotless except for files and repor piled on the floor. An exhausted Eve takes her lab coat o picks up a study and aims for the kitchen when a KNOCK co at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's open! Ron comes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Woodroof... Ron, I thought you were... Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 34 RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting her off) Dead? Sorry for bargin' in. EVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?   You look great. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually I look amazin'.   But you, you look like shit. EVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you? RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you got any music?   Or crackers? EVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but what is this? RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a celebration of how absolutely fuckin' wrong you were. Ron holds up a bottle of sparkling wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty days you said! Well here it is months later and I'm goin' like gangbusters. Now if that don't call for a little Cheez Whiz on a Ritz, I don't know what does! Ron heads for the refrigerator. EVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   Don't... I don't really eat here. The DOORBELL interrupts them. Ron watches as Eve crosses opens the door, admitting Rayon, looking like shit and sh badly in a full-length, pink fur coat. RAYON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Them bastards Kentucky fried me. Rayon sways; Eve grabs his arm.   Ron watches as Eve help Rayon inside. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 35 RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You women love Nancy Boys. Ron crosses to help Rayon to the couch.   He leans his he back, labors to breathe. EVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Rayon) Tell me what's wrong. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, I'll tell you what's wrong, it's the goddamn AZT! EVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's killin' him, can't you see that? Why you think I look so healthy? Ron reaches into his his jacket, produces a small BOX fil with MEDS. He takes out a brand new syringe and bottle of liquid. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tinkerbell, how much cash you got? Off his silence, Ron rummages through Rayon's purse, extr two twenties, pockets them, and starts preparing the syri EVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell do you think you're doing?! RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helpin' him, that's what. EVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a participant in a clinical trial, we need to get him to the hospital! RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So they can fuck him up even worse? Ron disregards her protests, starts to inject Rayon. EVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you out of your mind?!    If anything happens to him-- RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, it's just a little vitamin boost, A, C, zinc. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 36

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Rayon)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to live, get off the AZT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a blind study! We don't even know if he's getting AZT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone knows what they're gettin'. AZT tastes differently. I guess I got lucky and got the real thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, real lucky. (to Eve)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got stuff here that works. Healthy, non-toxic. You should trial it and we'll both get rich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave, please! Ron turns to Rayon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell your friends about me. Send `em my way and I'll hook `em up. Ron heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And tell `em to bring their fuckin' money. Cash. No checks. Eve and Rayon can't believe this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron stands in the heartland of the gay community, with SH BARS and CLUBS. He tries to engage gay PASSERSBY, none of whom will give him the time of day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With another support meeting underway, Ron talks to a sma group of GAY MEN, who look at him warily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dozens of GAY MEN mill about; Ron watches as some hold ha others grope one another. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 37 He spots a COUPLE just talking,   but as he approaches, t start making out. Ron stops in his tracks, turns to leave bumps right into a MAN dressed just like him, except this cowboy's CHAPS have nothing covering his ass. The guy nod for Ron to follow him inside the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you out of your fucking mind?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nurse Frazin monitors an AIDS PATIENT receiving a bloo transfusion, Eve reviews his chart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man also had a transfusion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AZT. We can tell who's on it by the symptoms. Most of them need new blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at chart)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's actually getting worse. Eve looks at the sleeping Patient; she reaches for his ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why are they stopping the trial?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barrow Wilkem, didn't you see the memo? They claim most people are feeling better and fewer people are dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In mid-conversation, Eve follows Dr. Sevard down the hall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transfusions always makes patients feel better. Give the placebo patients new blood and they'll feel better too. Sevard stops to sign a form for a NURSE. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 38

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have questions about the drug's safety. I've seen it drop white blood cells in a lot of my patients making them more susceptible to infection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Barrow Wilkem's call, Eve. So we can get the drug to the people who need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After six months?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their trial results are overwhelmingly positive. AZT is working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we have no idea what the long term effects are. It's irresponsible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These people die, Eve.     There are no long-term effects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I see a copy of the study?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still being written.    Here. He produces a two page document and hands it to Eve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A press release from the NIH? Sevard crosses off.   Eve stands there, stunned. Her POV on the press release: "HIV-positive patients are as likely to get AIDS if they don't take AZT."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron is parked on a quiet street. He counts his cash and i startled when suddenly a WOMAN gets in the passenger seat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulls a 9mm pistol)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Mother Mary Fuckin' Christ! She's not a woman, it's... Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 39 RAYON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was looking for you, Lonestar. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could of killed you! RAYON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel better! I wanted to thank you. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you. Now get the fuck out! RAYON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need more of that cocktail shit you got! RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen Tinkerbell, unless you got cash or some new clients for me, I'm busy. Now get the f... RAYON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Let's just do this quickly so I can get the fuck out! Rayon shows Ron a stack of bills.    A big one. RAYON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got enough for 20 of us? Rayon sees how Ron looks at his cash. RAYON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? You don't deserve our money, you homophobic asshole! Rayon gets out.   Ron watches him walk away in disbelief. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I fuckin' dreamin'? Rayon walks over to a FRIEND of his on the street.    Tha Ron's POV as he backs his car towards them. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's enough for 20, find me 20 more and I'll cut you in. Five percent. Rayon plays it cool, barely looks at Ron. RAYON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adios, cowboy. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 40

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can handle your insults, but five percent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty five, take it or leave it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 58    Ron shakes his head in disbelief. And nods.     Ray Ron's car with a big smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayon tries to get Ron to come in.   Ron doesn't want to. Rayon pushes him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the dance floor, Rayon grinds with a group of MEN. He waves Ron over from the sidelines. The cowboy with the chapless butt stares at Ron. Ron doesn't think it's funny

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayon is on the look out. Ron sells MEDS out of the trunk his car to a line of GAY MEN. A CUSTOMER hands him some c Ron reaches into his trunk and finds a pair of handcuffs slapped on his wrists. He's pushed against the cars, his kicked apart. Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron sits with David Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five grand worth of shit.   Shit I owe money on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard Barkley walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Woodroof. 90 days supply?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 40

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just sharing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with compassion) Listen, I know what the situation is. I know people are looking for solutions. But this is not the right one. This is dangerous. You can't sell drugs to people. Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I understand. David Wayne My client would like his drugs back for his own personal use. Richard Barkley They've already been destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron clenches his jaw, tries to remain cool. Richard Barkley I hope we have an understanding.   You're breaking the law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron is back to his reading. In front of him: NEWSPAPERS f SAN FRANCISCO, LONDON, NEW YORK. Ron sees something. Ligh bulb moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron and Rayon walk towards an old retro looking motel fro sixties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta be kidding me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, perfect place. We gotta lay low. Don't wanna get busted. I got a plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 41

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron stacks boxes in the room among his personal stuff. place looks like what it is: a cheap sex motel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is disgusting.    We need to disinfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not use the word "we". Now you wanna put your apron on and fly around on your broom, be my guest. Just then, a KNOCK on the open door.    Rayon and Ron loo see attorney DAVID WAYNE, 40s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howdy Counselor, welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, I'm Rayon. Wayne takes in Rayon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my partner.   Business partner. Ron throws a key to Rayon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your office's next door. Rayon gets the message and exits.   Wayne looks around at the boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, how many truck loads you bring back from Mexico? All for your own personal use? (gives Ron a folder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the paper work for your LLC. I don't even want to know what it's for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Counselor. I ain't selling drugs anymore. (off Wayne's look of surprise)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm giving them away. For free. (showing the folder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By selling memberships. Four hundred a month in dues gets you all the meds you need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 42

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne looks at him, thinking it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitches. Plural. There's a bunch of faggots runnin' a hell of a club up in New York. That's where I got the idea. (beat) Welcome to the Dallas Buyers Club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve pours herself a glass of red wine, cleans the stain l by the bottle on the counter and sits on the couch betwee paper works. CLOSE ON the TV NEWS ANCHOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barrow Wilkem announced today that AZT has been approved as the first drug to treat AIDS. At a cost of $10,000 per year per patient, AZT is the most expensive drug ever marketed. Barrow Wilkem stock jumped a whopping 12% today on the news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve sits, staring at the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The small room has been turned into an office. In his ver of a Nurse outfit, Rayon is taping photos of MARC BOLAN t wall. We now understand where Rayon's look comes from. TE MEN linger through the room and into the next one through connecting door...

dialogues.speaker: RON'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: Ron is behind a desk, atop which sits a gun, a bottle of Tequila and dozens of medical files. On the wall nearby a posters of SPORTS CARS and BIKINI MODELS as well as the T Wildflowers painting, news clippings regarding AIDS and a crude CHART listing Patients and their info: SYMPTOMS, DR TAKEN, and ORIENTATION (Gay, Drug Addict, Hemophiliac). Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 43 RAYON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he enters) Roanie, we have two new customers. Ron looks up from the chart he's filling out. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring 'em in and if you call me Roanie again... (grabs his gun) ...I'ma use this gun to give you the sex change you been hopin' for. Rayon shakes his head, walking off, as IAN and MICHAEL, a conservative gay couple in their 50s appear in the doorwa They look at Ron's gun and hesitate to walk in. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah shit, did I scare you? Sorry. Welcome to the Dallas Buyers Club. Ron puts the gun away.   Ian and Michael sit down.   Ian clearly very ill. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayon said you can get us some medicine. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He told you how it works? Treatments and drugs are free, but the membership, 400$. They nod yes. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing them a clipboard) You'll have to sign a waiver. We take no responsibility for the drugs we give you. You croak, you croak. That's your problem. Michael looks at Ian, who nods okay.   They sign the waiv MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have AZT, it helped Ian a little at first, but now he can't walk or think straight. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First of all, flush that shit down the toilet. Secondly, stay away from anything that'll cook your insides. Third, get healthy and if your brain's broke, I got something called Peptide T that'll fix it. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 44 Michael looks at Ian, not sure what to think.     Ron han each a questionnaire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fill that there out and don't cheat on the drugs part. Can't help you if I don't know what you're doin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron puts a box of pills on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got more stuff comin' in about a week. Til then, watch what you eat and who you eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve paces, checks her watch as Nurse Frazin sits nearby reviewing files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't call, leave a message?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. (then; off file) He did change his address recently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still in her white lab coat, Eve gets out of her car and towards an open door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boxes of drugs and herbs everywhere. Ron is on the phone arguing with someone, a small Japanese-English dictionary his hand. He stops in his tracks when he sees Eve walking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind. I'll call back.   Thank you. Arigato.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I live here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 45

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Rayon?     You're roommates now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly. What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confused, Eve looks down on Ron's desk, picks up a file. He moves to stop her, but he's too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger Thompson? This is my patient.        Are you treating these people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're treatin' themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitamins, Peptide T, DDC. Anything but that poison you're hawkin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve starts to look at the chart.      A few beats, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you ever wear any color?    Every time I see you I see white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron smiles.   Eve does not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Rayon I was looking for him. And I'm telling my patients to stay away from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve walks out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? You wanna go grab a steak?     I know it's red but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A near empty cart stands next to Ron as he studies the la on a box. Rayon, dressed in his pink coat, walks up. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 46 RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the shit that'll rot your insides. What a surprise, FDA approved. What the fuck is potassium benzoate? RAYON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Preservative. Rayon throws a pack of bologna in the cart. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fuckin' kiddin' me? Defiant, Rayon puts his hand on his hips. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't pollute me with that processed crap. I'm eatin' healthy. Ron removes the bologna and throws it at Rayon who almost fumbles the catch. RAYON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's protein, it's good for you. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it back. Rayon tosses it back at Ron. RAYON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't tell me what to do. Ron throws the Bologna harder at Rayon, who catches it li pro football player, much to Ron's surprise. Rayon enjoys moment and disappears down the isle, proud, with his bolo under the arm. Ron turns the corner of the next isle. T.J. is there putt a case of BEER in his shopping cart. An uncomfortable mom passes. T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, hey Ron. Ron nods at him. T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're you doin'? RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 47 Rayon appears at the other end of the isle.      T.J. see laughs. T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, faggots everywhere. T.J. looks at Ron for confirmation.   Rayon reaches them throws a bag of chips in the cart. RAYON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. T.J. and Ron don't answer.    An awkward beat. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Rayon. (off T.J.'s silence)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said hi to you. Rayon sticks out his hand.    T.J. doesn't respond. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shake his hand, T.J. He doesn't. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, buddy, what's your fuckin' problem? T.J. gives Ron the finger. Ron grabs T.J.'s hand and twis it behind his back. T.J. resists, tries to get out of Ron grip but can't. He finally extends his hand. Rayon shakes it. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Now get the fuck outta here and go back to your miserable life. T.J. stares at Ron for a while, angry, humiliated, then leaves. Ron watches him go. Rayon stares at Ron, unsure o how to react to this. A subtle smile appears on his face. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Rayon's moved that Ron stuck up for him.   He starts to t up. Ron sees the bag of chips in the cart and throws it at Ra Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 48

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two dozen MEN, all prospective buyers, snake down the lon exterior hallway. A NEIGHBOR walks by, disgusted, hugging wall as he makes it to his own door. That is Ron's POV following at a distance as he arrives f the supermarket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young, gay man, FREDDIE, stands awkwardly fidgeting by door, makeup poorly masking lesions on his face and neck. line of customers is snaking behind him. Ron sees Freddie money, grabs it and counts it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty bucks. (yelling to the line)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't got the money, you don't join the club. This ain't no charity. Ron gives Freddy his money back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need three hundred and fifty more. DENISE, a Club volunteer, early forties, walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beaumont Lab's delivery is here.    A woman says you were expecting her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANCINE SUSKIND (37), stands in front of Ron's desk look at a MAN behind her wheeling in cardboard boxes on a doll

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can get it abroad but in the States, we can only use it for animal research. It's not classified as a drug so the FDA does not control it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm usin' it for memory loss.   You oughta try gettin' it to market.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It costs around 250 million dollars to get a drug to market. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 49

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, bureaucracy is good business. Francine smiles, she likes Ron.   The man places the BOXE marked PEPTIDE T on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are for your animal research. Ron winks at her, waits for the delivery man to leave, an produces a plastic BAG filled with vials and drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And these are for your daughter. She takes the bag of medication and surprisingly becomes emotional. She holds it back, tries to say thank you but can't. Ron nods "it's ok". She hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayon finishes packing Ron's suitcase.   He's high.   Was

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron works the combination lock on a safe. He stops. Wonde what's wrong. Looks dizzy. He goes to his desk and pops s pills. Takes a deep breath. Rayon enters with the suitcase and a Pan Am airline envel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all packed, here's your ticket. Ron removes a stack of cash from the safe and hands it to Rayon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keeps the money)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus! Are you fuckin' high?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of your business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, it is if I can't fuckin' trust you. (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denise! Denise shows up from the other room. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 49

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: You're in charge!

dialogues.speaker: RAYON
dialogues.text: (grabs the money) No! You can trust me! Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 50 They stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure my new Caddy is at the airport for when I get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denise, you hearin' this? Now you two monkeys take care of the zoo. And as Ron takes his suitcase and exits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Denise)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep an eye on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 747 soars across the sky.      On screen appears: Hayashira Chemical Lab - Okayama, Japan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Briefcase in hand, cowboy hat on his head, Ron waits alon with JAPANESE MEN who all stare at him. After a few beats MR. YAMATA, the lab's manager approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Woodroof?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's me. Yamata bows, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Regarding your order. I am so sorry, but we are no longer allowed to export interferon to the United States.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am sorry. I know you've come a long way. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 50

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Fourteen hours on a plane, but hey, who gives a shit, right? (off Yamata's look) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 51

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, if it's a matter of money, I can make it worth your while, I got cash--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) Please understand. Japanese doctors will be the only ones who can make the purchase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as Ron's wheels turn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON -- DR. HIROSHI, 40s, who sits talking on the pho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Japanese) ...that is correct. Two thousand vials of alpha interferon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A REVERSE ANGLE reveals Ron, across from Hiroshi. Over th above, he slides ten $100 dollar bills across the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Japanese) That's right. Delivered directly to my office. Thank you. (to Ron) Slow drip. Very strong. Slow drip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron walks to Dr. Hiroshi, thanks him, and looks him over head to toe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron packs his suitcase and puts on a ROLEX and an expensi ring.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Ron looks at his reflection in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CUSTOMS OFFICER looks at Ron dressed with Dr. Hiroshi's coat, and wearing Dr. Sevard's hair style as he talks int large first generation cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm coming. Prepare the sedation. Propofol. 10 milligrams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 52

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I'm coming. (hangs up, to the officer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron enters the Men's rest room carrying his suitcase and briefcase, and disappears in a...

dialogues.speaker: STALL
dialogues.text: Ron injects a needle into his arm. On the toilet, an empty VIAL from the BRIEFCASE. Ron takes his lab coat off and stops. A searing pain cour through his chest. Ron grimaces. The strange ringing agai in his ears. Then another shooting pain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker and a fellow POLICE OFFICER are doing paperwork ne a MAN covered with BLOOD. Tucker has a double take when h sees an unconscious Ron being wheeled in on a stretcher b PARAMEDICS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visible through an open door, Ron lies in bed in a hospit gown, hooked up to an I.V. tube. In the hall, Tucker and Sevard are with the FDA's Richard Barkley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know what the drugs are.    He's got HIV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woodroof?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron hears the voices in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That a party out there? Dr. Sevard and the others hear Ron, enter his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Woodroof. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 53 RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc-tor Sevard!   You must be surprised to see me. DR. SEVARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You nearly killed yourself. We need to know where you acquired those drugs. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: I.V. tube) And I need to know what you're pumpin' into me here. DR. SEVARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A combination of AZT... RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   Get it out! Ron rips the I.V. out of his arm. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna sue you for attempted murder! Where's my stuff? DR. SEVARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your stuff gave you a heart attack. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to hell. I say what goes in my body, not you. Final. Period. End of story. DR. SEVARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That decision, like it or not, is left up to the people in this hospital. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This thing's an epidemic and you're still lookin for guinea pigs. Well do I look like a rodent to you? RICHARD BARKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Woodroof, we tolerate the Buyers Clubs. Now, every other organization in the country is dancing with us but for some reason, either you don't understand what we're saying or you just don't give a shit. DR. SEVARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a fool if you think you're helping yourself. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 53

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: That's right. I fooled you.   You told me I'd be dead in thirty days. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 54

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well HOWDYFUCKINDOODY, cuz it's a year later and look whose still here? Tucker tries to stifle a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I'm through with you. You got anything to say, tell it to my real doctor, Dr. Saks. Rayon rushes in carrying Ron's leather jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was so worried --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my suitcase?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Woodroof, would you please get back in bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. And if you're gonna call an orderly on me, you'd better fuckin' do it, cuz this motherfucker is going home. 81   Ron grabs his leather jacket and throws it on.    He and we see he's naked under his gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve sits behind her desk, Dr. Sevard standing across from

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're his physician and you can't tell me what medications he's on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He came in once for advice. I have no idea what he does outside of this hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well the FDA confiscated over two thousand vials of alpha interferon... that he was about to sell to AIDS patients. Our patients! Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 54

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (testing the waters) Actually, I've been reading about Buyers Clubs. They say they found other drugs that are eliminating symptoms. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 55

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without controlled trials, we'll never be able to cure this thing because we'll have no legitimate data. Tell your patients to stay away from him. With that, Sevard exits.   On Eve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of activity, many EMPLOYEES on phones, SHIPMENTS com in, new CLIENTS lined up through the connecting door into RON'S OFFICE. Maps of the different locations around the country where buyers clubs have shown up, New-York, San- Francisco, Miami.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding a phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy says the Florida Buyers Club is cheaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then tell him to move to the fuckin' sunshine state! A phone cradled in his neck, Ron accepts a shipment of se dozen boxes from a guy we saw earlier in Mexico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean you can't get it back?! It was authorized by a doctor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FDA said it was a Japanese doctor with no legal standing. What can I say, they make it up as they go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 84               Then check China, Amsterdam and Israel cause that's where I'm fuckin' goin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLANES take off and LAND; we track Ron making his way thr various airports and international cities; we see a serie Departure Boards - Tel Aviv; Amsterdam; Hong Kong. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 58

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet open for business. As Rayon and his friend SUNNY photos on a freshly-painted nearby wall. Eve stands acros from Ron with her arms crossed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got first hand experience with all of 'em. And I'll tell you something else, if I don't know what somethin' is, or don't trust the white coat who's trying to sell it to me, I fed-ex it to my lab in Seattle and they test if for me. Eve looks around at all the boxes and files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I test it all on myself before I give it to anyone else. (off her look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm my own lab rat. He grabs a box of meds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Compound Q. You know what happens if I come off it? My hair falls out, I lose weight, I can't get my dick up and I start to die. I got three hundred other people with the same experience. (grabs another box)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peptitde T. Gets rid of dementia. Stop takin' it and you can't think straight, walk straight, or act straight. I got over two hundred people on that. You following me? (grabs another box)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DDC and DDI, both toxic, but in small doses, helps kick opportunistic infections.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron, I respect that you're learning about your illness but some of these people should be in the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the hospital wants is to serve up AZT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AZT helps eradicate the virus. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 58 RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck the virus, once you got that, you're married to it. I'm more concerned about my symptoms and survival. I mean, I'm no scientist but... RAYON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mocking him) You're not? 'Cause you sound so... scientific. Rayon and Sunny laugh like children. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fuckin' high again? RAYON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giggling) I dunno. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you listenin' to what I'm sayin' here about usin' that shit? (then; noticing) And what the fuck did you do to my wall?! RAYON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cranberry mocha.     For the holidays. Ron looks back at Eve, exasperated.    He grabs a folder desk. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People can live with this thing for longer than they're saying. Ninety-six- percent of people diagnosed with AIDS in the U S of A will be dead in under six months. EVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the statistics. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then use them. Why give people AZT when their immune system is broken? It's fuckin' toxic! EVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're abusing it, like you did, with no medical surveillance, of course it is. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 58

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I did abuse it, but I'm off it now, and I'm here, feeling good. And I'm not the only one. Ron turns to Rayon and Sunny, who are hanging Marc Bolan' pictures on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is Boy George's goddamned face everywhere in my room? Rayon and Sunny laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Marc Bolan, silly! Why don't you just get it over with and say it, you love it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Rayon's Friend)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your sunflower and get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine! Rayon and Sunny leave the room, laughing. Ron TEARS down Bolan's pictures, and throws down the folder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what, look at it, don't look at it, I don't give a shit. 87   After a beat, Eve takes the folder. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 59

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 89    Ron looks at his reflection in the mirror. Looks li woke up. He stands over the sink taking his meds, pouring pills from among a DOZEN bottles. He finishes taking the pills, washing them down with water. Runs his hands throu his hair, looks at himself in the mirror, tries to find a flattering angle. He stands there looking at himself. Aft a while, he nods his approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sevard is about to walk into a room but stops in his trac Dumbfounded, he walks towards another room, shakes his he and continues to the nurse's station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell are my trial patients?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nurse Frazin ignores him and walks away. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 60

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is jammed with BUYERS. On the wall, people add their information to Ron's ever growing chart. EMPLOYEES unpack boxes and wait to talk to Ron who walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron walks past the line of customers and up the stairs to second floor. He spots a MAN leaning against his new Cadillac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayon, sick again, rolls down his pants and prepares to i a needle into his thigh. He closes his eyes, brings the wavering needle closer to his skin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you ain't doin' poppers and coke, how come you look like such shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayon ignores Ron, tries to muster up the courage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You pussy, stick it in. Who do you think is gonna do that when I ain't here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayon looks at Ron with pleading eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayon, I swear, God sure was dressin' the wrong doll when he blessed you with a pair of balls. (walks over) Give me that thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron takes the needle and injects Rayon with the drug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it's one thing for me not to like you, but why don't you be a better friend to yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I really thought you were interested, I'd tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, the door opens.   It's Ron's attorney, David W Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 61

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doin' here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds up paper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're being audited. The IRS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron and David Wayne look on as two IRS AGENTS carry out b of receipts and other financial records.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice work, fellas, great. This is how you got Al Capone, ain't it? As the Agents exit:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't piss them off. If there's a fine, we'll pay it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fine? Fine, alright, how much? Ten thousand? Twenty thousand? I'll write you a check right now. Ron grabs his check book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think that will stop me, you motherfuckers! 93   David waves Ron down with his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayon is prepping shipping boxes with Sunny, drawing abst artistic designs on the boxes. Ron walks out of the bathroom dressed in a gangster style suit. Rayon gives him the once over. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 62

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, you don't have a snowball's chance wearing that thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayon, I don't need help gettin' ladies from your sorry ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trailer trash and rodeo groupies do not count as ladies. Are you sure she said the word yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got any flowers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron looks around, spots the Wild Flower PAINTING. He walk over and yanks it off the wall, looks at Rayon defiantly, it under his arm and storms out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve waits in a booth. She watches a couple flirt at anoth table. The WOMAN laughs and tosses her hair back. Eve sel consciously tucks her hair behind her ear. She stops, realizes what she's doing. Just then, Ron approaches with PAINTING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the Wildflowers.   Texas style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron hands her the painting.    She smiles, plays along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're beautiful. Thank you.    And I don't even have to water them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron slides in across from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.   She looks at his suit and smiles politely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The IRS is on my ass.   I wonder who tipped them off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 63 EVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't actually believe I would do that? RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. But you gonna have to watch what you say when you're around that snake you work with. He's the virus I'm worried about. As a matter fact, if you hear of anything... She shakes her head, amused.   A WAITER approaches. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring us your best bottle of Cabernet. The Waiter nods and leaves. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice restaurant, beautiful woman. I feel like a human being again. (a beat) How come you ain't got no high powered corporate honey to take you dancin'? EVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't dance. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cause you don't got a honey.   How old are you anyway? Twenty two? Eve shoots him a "nice try" look.   She wonders, is he he flirt or talk business? Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 64 EVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are we here? RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To eat, drink, enjoy life, be merry... EVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah right. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a break, relax, breathe, Saks. She sits back, smiles, the waiter comes back with the win RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Normal people do that, ya know. She takes a proper sip of wine as he takes a gulp. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why'd you become a doctor? EVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I was good in science. And my father said studying history was a waste of time. So I went to med school. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not what I thought you'd say but makes sense, your dad was a practical man. EVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he was. Your turn. Why did you become... an electrician, right? RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well my old man was an electrician. A good one too. But he was a better drinker. Which I learned from him as well. Ron raises his glass in a toast.   They share a smile. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I was around it a lot. Got pretty good at takin' shit apart, seein' how the insides worked, and then puttin' it back together. I was good at it and it put some change in my pocket. EVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your mom? Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 64

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was a painter, kind of a gypsy.     She got tired a' all the shit and left.     You know how it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Wildflowers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She painted that, your mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't feel like you gotta hang it.     I know you like everything perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not. I'll hang it. I'm going to hang it. It's just... are you sure you don't want to keep it? Ron looks at her.   A long time, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to enjoy your life, little lady. You only got one. 96   The Waiter approaches with the wine.     Ron and Eve each other, enjoying their company. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 65

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear someone breathing. We're on one of the POSTERS of bikini clad woman. We pan to another poster of another gi then another. The breathing is getting more intense. It's obvious that someone is masturbating. Then we're on a POS of... Marc Bolan. The breathing stops. Ron walks into fra and tears Bolan's poster down. Then he spots another one. And another one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna kill him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron sifts through boxes of inventory with a clipboard in hand. A sickly looking Rayon sits on the sofa sipping a cup of tea, watching TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're running low on DDC and Peptide-T, I thought you were stocking this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down and shut up. Ron's POV on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New studies have proven that AZT is effective in stopping the progression of AIDS in asymptomatic cases. Dr. Anthony Fauci, head of the National Institute of Health, announced that a trial had clearly shown that early AZT intervention will keep AIDS at bay. AZT is the only drug that has been shown in scientifically controlled trials to be safe and effective, Fauci contended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 66

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phone to her ear, Eve sits watching the same broadcast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scientifically controlled, my ass! They took eight months to approve it. And from what we know now, AZT is everything but safe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve stands talking to Nurse Frazin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want all my HIV patients on the asymptomatic study to have their AZT doses lowered to the minimum, 600 milligrams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the line snaking out the door, Ron sits behind the d dealing with a BUYER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's four pills, three times a day with food. The vitamins too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ron starts putting the meds in a paper bag, we hear a commotion coming from the other room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not letting you in, you have a search warrant?

dialogues.speaker: RAYON'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: Rayon, still in his robe, stands blocking the doorway to Richard Barkley who signals to Tucker to take over. Tucke gestures to Rayon to move out of the way. He walks in wit FELLOW POLICE OFFICER and two DRUG ENFORCEMENT ADMINISTRA (DEA) agents. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 67 RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell's all this? TUCKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Ron. (to the Buyers) Gentlemen, I'm gonna need you all to leave the premises in an orderly fashion, please! Some GRUMBLING as the Buyers file out.   Barkley enters. RICHARD BARKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Woodroof, I have a court order permitting us to confiscate any and all non-FDA approved drugs or supplements. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In other words, my entire inventory. Ron looks over at one of the FDA Agents, who has begun op boxes. As the Agent removes an unmarked bottle: RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aloe vera! It's a plant. What do you give a shit if people eat plants? RICHARD BARKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's improperly labeled. That's a violation of FDA regulations. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a bullshit technicality and you know it! (to Rayon) Get my lawyer on the phone. Rayon crosses off to make the call. RICHARD BARKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our primary concern is preventing a market for illegal drugs. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Illegal? Unapproved! These are vitamins and minerals, for Chrissake! RICHARD BARKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitamins and minerals that gave you a heart attack, remember? RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not selling that stuff, you confiscated it, remember? Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 68 The agents confiscate lots of small blue boxes and put th an evidence bag. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) What's the matter, you got Alzheimer, Richard? (pointing at the blue boxes) 'Cause Peptide T works for Alzheimers too, ya know? Tucker looks over at Ron. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, it's a protein! Effective with dementia which I have. Why don't you just look at my research? RICHARD BARKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woodroof, I wouldn't want you to spend your last days in jail. If you have a product you'd like tested, fill out an application and go through the process. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't threaten me! I'm unapproved motherfucker! The process? That's just FDA bullshit for pay up! 250 million worth! The Agents exit carrying boxes and bags; Barkley gives Ro big smile. RICHARD BARKLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be receiving your fine for non compliance and improper labelling soon. Barkley leaves followed by Tucker who looks sorry for Ron Rayon comes back to the room. He takes a last peek throug the window, and pulls boxes of Peptide T from underneath robe, with the smile of a kid on his face, handing Ron th phone. RAYON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your lawyer. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These fuckers are comin' at me from all angles! I wanna file a restraining order! DAVID WAYNE (O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   Against who? Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 69

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Government and their fuckin' FDA!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams down the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta relocate!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve is at her desk when suddenly Dr. Sevard barges in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who gave you permission to lower your patients' AZT doses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need permission.    I'm their doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
