dialogues.text: I want those doses readjusted immediately. The study protocol does not allow dose reductions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not doing a study for people who are asymptomatic with a toxic drug that makes them sick. We don't treat people who have antibodies for pneumonia or chicken pox when they're healthy. Why should HIV be any different?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a different kind of virus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says who?     Barrow Wilkem?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Sevard stares at Eve, who stands her ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, I consulted with each of them individually, it was their decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sevard leaves, fuming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and effective immediately...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 70

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON TV: we see Ron and Rayon's reflection as they're watching FDA commissioner Frank Young standing at a podiu before a dozen microphones, mid-press conference, bombard camera flashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Americans with life-threatening illnesses will be permitted to import small quantities of unapproved drugs for their personal use. Under this arrangement, the drugs may only be purchased by individuals who have been prescribed the medication by a physician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron turns the TV off, shakes his head as he walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means we were unapproved.    Now we're illegal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron pulls out a brown paper BAG from inside the PAPER TOW DISPENSER. He removes a stack of CASH, puts it in his coa places a BLUE BOX into the dispenser and closes the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron walks out to a table where Rayon is waiting. Rayon ha ledger in front of him. His condition is deteriorating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayon gathers his things and gets up to leave. Ron looks and sees TUCKER looking at him as he's drinking a beer ac the room with a few other cops. Ron signals to a waitress

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send a round of beers over to my friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron throws some cash down on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save your money, we're broke.   Our credit cards are maxed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 71

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred grand between the FDA and the IRS fines. The pharmacy bills due...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron ignores him.   A busty waitress floats by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How bout that size?   Those would look good on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't gettin' tits, Rayon. Memberships are high and so is demand. So we recruit more members from where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Support groups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep! I'm gotta find MDs to write them prescriptions so we can keep dealin' these drugs... legally now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the meantime we could try the bank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, Bonnie and Clyde comin' in for a loan. Stop starin' at her tits, you're startin' to look normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker, still in his police uniform, finishes clearing th table after dinner with his old father, who sits silently rocking chair. Tucker opens the BLUE BOX and removes a Buyers Club bottl Peptide T and a note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuck, sorry to hear about your dad's Alzheimer. This will help. Woodroof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house hasn't seen new carpet since the 60's. The conservative gay couple we met earlier, Ian and Michael, Ron around. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 72

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is crap, I'll give you one fifty a month and fifty percent off your meds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Woodroof --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't try to con me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't want money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is free.   We want to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron looks from Ian and Michael and back again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.   Well that's good news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ian sticks his hand out, Ron shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same meeting from the beginning; packed with mostly g MEN. A different group of people are here now, but the atmosphere is the same. Ron stands at the back of the auditorium with Rayon at hi side chewing gum like a baseball coach. Ron flips the lig off and on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello... Howdy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CROWD calms down, turns to look at Ron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got what you got and I have traveled the world looking for alternative medications, stuff not available yet in America, thanks to the good folks down at the FDA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A murmur travels through the audience as people listen. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 73

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of you may have heard of the Dallas Buyers Club, an organization I founded with my friend Rayon. Risk might be high, but what the hell, you're risking your life every time you go into one of them there hospitals. (beat) I don't know where most of the people are who were at these meetings a year and a half ago... maybe they lost interest... maybe they're dead... but I'm here. I'm walking, talking, breathing... and ain't no one gonna take that away from me. I gotta life to lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A murmur travels through the audience as people listen. The point of our club was to get alternative treatments and medications into the hands of those who need 'em. (beat) The cost of joining this club used to be $400 a month. Well I'm here tonight with a special offer. Anyone who's interested can come and sign up for the one-time only, rock bottom price of zero. (beat) That's right, I'm giving it away folks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More murmurs through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIV don't mean shit. You ain't sick, you ain't sick. Period. You tell a guy he's got a week to live? Shit, he's already dead. You tell a guy he can keep on goin'? He'll find a way. Remember, ya ain't dyin'. But if you think you are then you ain't got nothing to lose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron does a double take at Rayon who is staring at him wit tears in his eyes. Someone hesitantly applauds. A MAN get up and walks to Ron, slowly OTHERS do too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A financial institution. A MAN, 50s, walks over to the waiting area and coldly signals a younger man to follow h This is Rayon, hair slicked back, devoid of makeup and jewelry, wearing Ron's business suit. He gets up. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 73

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayon looks at the various family PHOTOS which decorate t bookshelves of the man's office who sits behind his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess I didn't make the cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made that choice yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't a choice, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayon's father looks at him with disdain. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 74

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want, Raymond?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine, thanks.    And you?   Long time no see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose I should thank you for wearing men's clothes and not embarrassing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Are you ashamed of me?   Because I never realized that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) God help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is helpin' you.   I got AIDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat during which Rayon's father finally shows som sympathy. Rayon looks like his father's son for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, dad. I found someone who's been helping me and now I'd like to help him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayon finishes taking Ron's suit off and looks at his reflection, takes in the lesions on his naked body, grabs compact and a tube of lipstick, and starts putting making on his face, holding back tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, when I meet you, I'm gonna look pretty if it's the last thing I do. I'll be a super model angel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron is on the PHONE, his personal address book in his han There is MOVING BOXES scattered throughout the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   No, please, wait a minute, doc...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 75 The phone CLICKS. Ron slams the phone down several times. Suddenly Rayon enters as he finishes buttoning up his dre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the MDs are fuckin' backpeddlin' on their heels. The FDA is scaring them with license revocation if they write scripts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayon throws a cash filled envelope on Ron's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe this will help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron looks at the cash in disbelief: two wrapped wads of hundred dollar bills, worth maybe $10,000.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayon exits the room proudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you sell your ass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a simple fuckin' thank you would do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron looks at the cash, shakes his head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Rayon walks into his room, Ron appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, come on, where did you get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat.    Rayon hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sold my life insurance policy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron offers Rayon a hand shake. Rayon opens his arms. hug. Ron whispers a heartfelt, "thank you."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seated at her desk, Eve looks up when she hears a KNOCK o door. Ron, wearing a huge SOMBRERO HAT, enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 76 RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goin' to Mexico, chica, you comin'? Ron takes his hat off and puts it on her head, covering h eyes. From Eve's point of view, it's pitch black until sh adjusts the hat, amused. EVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I look like someone who takes vacations? RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, tequila, sunshine, tacos, never hurt anybody. Eve enjoys the attention.   Shakes her head. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you'd rain on my party, but I had to give it a shot. (a beat) Listen, I gotta ask you a favor. I need you to write me prescriptions so I can come across the border. I might not need it but if I do, I'll have them. Eve doesn't respond. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know this rule that the FDA just passed was just bullshit. Ain't no doc from here to the north pole will write them. EVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know and I can't either. I'm sorry. We can't write scripts for random people and random drugs. Plus what if something goes wrong with these drugs? We could get sued, lose our license. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay!   Never hurts to ask. Eve takes the hat off and hands it to Ron. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it, nurse Ratched! Ron exits the room leaving Eve with the sombrero. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 77

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music plays. Rayon, extremely sick, holds a bottle of POPPERS, watches Sunny dance around the room amongst the stacked moving boxes. Rayon starts coughing into a scarf, pulls it away, it's covered with BLOOD. Sunny stops danci

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to go to the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayon can't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.      I'm driving you, right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunny walks over and picks up Rayon, throws him over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. I'll go. Put me down.       Let me get some things first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayon picks up his bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron enters the clinic with a suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a BUTTERFLY, emerald green wings with a blood re middle. Its wings flap with life as a hand holds it and a needle is inserted into its middle, extracting its fluids Dr. Vass conducts the experiment with Ron looking on. background, another makeshift lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secretions that the caterpillar uses to protect itself during the incubation period...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Vass empties the contents of the syringe into a test-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...act as a non-toxic anti-viral for humans. The answer to a question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Vass sets the test-tube on a tray, crosses to a table lined with boxes, postmarks in different languages coveri their surfaces. He rummages on the table, finds a report. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 78

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing it to Ron) The Lancet medical journal published a study conducted in France. Proves AZT alone is too toxic for most to tolerate, and had no lasting effect on HIV blood levels. Of course, Barrow Wilkem and the NIH did not include the study in their press release.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron takes the study, looks it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't surprise me at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vass hands Ron some more paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are early trial results for Fluconazole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The anti-fungal, right?   I read about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to take some home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As much I can carry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need a thousand more like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell Vass, I'm just tryin' to run a business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve walks in, breathless. Eyes sunken, breathing shallow, Rayon is hooked up to an I.V. as Nurse Frazin adjusts an oxygen mask on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took him off of it as you instructed. He's just on morphine now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I'll be in my office.   Thanks for calling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 79 She sees Sunny outside of the room, watching.   She gives hopeful smile and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron leaves the lab and notices an ominous green glow comi from a nearby room. He approaches it slowly, drawn to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he enters, he notices hundreds of emerald green BUTTER flying in the air and hanging on the wall. Their vibrant colors give off a luminous glow. A butterfly lands on his hand. He slowly raises his hand to his face for a better view. As time goes on, more and more butterflies land on Ron's hand and body. Ron takes it all in. Illuminated fro the butterflies, he looks like a "Lite-Brite".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve wakes up, seated at her desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayon lies alone in bed, delirious from morphine, mumblin beneath his oxygen mask. After a few beats, he takes it o leans over to the side table, takes a compact and a tube lipstick from his purse, and starts to apply it, his hand trembling as he does. His mission accomplished, he sets t lipstick aside, then leans his head back. And as he close his eyes and drifts away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron sits in his seat happily scribbling prescriptions for drugs he is bringing in. On the pad we see the name - Dr. Eve Saks, the same pad.. FLASHBACK: ...that Ron took in Eve's office when she had sombrero on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boxes filled with hundreds of small bottles of Fluconazol on the floor. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 80 Ron sits in a chair looking on as an FDA AGENT flips thro his prescriptions, while another AGENT compares the names those on the bottles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reads names) Walker, Dorsett, Blount, Newsome, Jeffcoat... these are patients?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're also the names of players on the Dallas Cowboys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit? Well how's that for a coincidence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't this a little ridiculous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you prove these are patients?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you prove they're not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Agent looks at him, then resignedly continues to flip through the prescriptions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron walks in. Denise stops unloading moving boxes and han him a stack of messages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are the emergencies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron flips through them, stops, looks around the room, and notices Rayon's favorite Marc Bolan's posters on the wall his new headquarters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Rayon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 81 What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron rushes into Rayon's room. The bed is empty. The sheet are on the floor. Seen from behind, Sunny places Rayon's belongings in Rayon's bag. He turns. His eyes are bloodsh He looks at Ron and is about to start crying again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nurse Frazin is startled by off stage loud breaking noise Ron walks out of Rayon's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sevaaaaard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ron walks past her, Nurse Frazin grabs the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need security up here, right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron pushes open different doors looking for Dr. Sevard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron storms into a room where several PATIENTS wait for appointments. Some are completely healthy, others are sho signs of sickness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sevard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron spots Sevard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are, you son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call yourself a doctor?   You are a murderer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patients in the hallway turn their heads towards the commotion. Eve walks out of a room and watches. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 82

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave or you will be arrested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrest me? (to the waiting patients)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear that? Two SECURITY GUARDS enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First class everything, big house, Mercedes Benz. That's what they pay him to say it's OK to pump poison into y'all. The GUARDS move to grab Ron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from me.   I got AIDS.   I'll spit on you. Ron spits on the floor. The guards back off.    Dr. Sevar watches slack-jawed as Ron continues to spit.   The guard him... ... as Eve watches Sevard, emotionally charged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see this? This is harassment. Get me my attorney or do I have to be my own lawyer too. Own doctor, own lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron slams the car door shut, walks towards the house watc the line of men snaking out the door. He takes them in. M of them look very sick. His eyes stop on Freddy who's watching him. Freddy smiles as he waves cash at Ron who feigns a smile and walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron enters as Denise finishes handing out information to very sick MEN. Denise makes her way over to Ron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: sick men)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Austin. All on AZT. Their insurance is paying for the treatment and they don't know if they can afford to switch. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 83

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hook `em up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're pretty cash poor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron walks towards his office, stops, turns around and thr his car keys to Denise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sell my car and make sure everyone gets what they need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron pours himself some tequila and gulps it down. Pours himself another glass. A hooker is dancing in front of hi No music. She starts to touch him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes down on him.   He stops her, and leaves, throwin money on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron wakes up to A KNOCK on the door.   Eve walks in.   A beat. Ron doesn't even look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anemia, Cancer, Bone Marrow depletion, Fever, Diarrhea, Vomiting, Neuropathy, Anxiety, Dizziness, Impotence, Hearing loss, Nervousness, Seizures... Sound like AIDS to you? That there comes inside a box of AZT, a list of side effects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayon was a drug addict! It wasn't a day on AZT that killed him, but the disease as a whole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron registers.   Calms down a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron, you stole my prescription pad! So don't accuse me of acting irresponsibly! Rayon came to the hospital on his own...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 83 RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting her off) ... and got carried out in a trash bag three days later! EVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) He was my friend too, you know! They both get quiet.   A beat during which Eve is holding tears. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 84

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me ask you something. Let's say I have the cure right here in my back pocket. I could save everyone today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve's expression changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't have no funding and I don't have no backing. Now how long is it gonna take before the FDA approves it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron crosses to the desk, produces a copy of the Lancet Me Journal Study he got from Dr. Vass, and hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read that and you tell me how wrong is too wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve walks into her house, opens a drawer, removes a hamme smashes it down on a nail and misses. She smashes the ham down again, harder, and again, and again. Her POV: lots o holes in the wall, very far from the nail, and soon hidde Ron's painting of the Texas Wildflowers. She walks away without straightening it, sits down and starts reading th "Lancet Study".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got three thousand people who need to get their hands on Peptide T. Now. Including me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron paces the floor as David Wayne walks in with a big cardboard box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shut her lab down. The FDA has shut all of our suppliers down, what can I tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I don't get it by the end of the week I wanna file a lawsuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Ron, we lost the restraining order, remember? We're in Texas. The court system is the last resort for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 85

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well find a place where it's not, Goddamnit. Go to San Francisco, get a sissy judge, figure it out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron spots a FLYER on the cardboard box and grabs it. reads: "DALLAS BUYERS CLUB NEWSLETTER".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve watches as young apparently healthy CHILDREN wait wit their PARENTS to complete forms. She goes up to Dr. Sevar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barrow Wilkem gave us the green light on the AZT pediatric trials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? This is crazy!   All these kids are HIV positive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sevard looks uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're starting very slowly with a fifth of a dose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you give this fifth of a dose to your own child?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TouchГ©.   Sevard holds her gaze for a moment and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOUNG CHILDREN are waiting with their parents. Among them girl with her mother, Francine Suskind, the woman from Beaumont Lab whom Ron met earlier. Eve walks in and discreetly places Dallas Buyers Club fly on a table, then walks off. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 86

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is packed. On the dais stands Richard Barkley fr the FDA. To his left and right, are representatives from Center for Disease Control, the National Institute of Hea and ACT-UP. They HEAR something SQUEAKING and look up: At the back of the room, Ron enters, hooked up to an I.V. on wheels that he carries along as he starts passing out copies of his flyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go, please read this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Woodroof, will you kindly tell us what you are doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone turns to look at Ron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm givin' people information... on this trial I'm in, right now. I want everyone here to know what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why was Peptide T cut off? A non-toxic drug, that I have proof works and that according to the National Institute of Mental Health, is completely safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Woodroof, you are nothing but a common drug dealer--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a drug dealer? You're the drug dealer. The pharmaceutical companies are the drug dealers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron grabs a bag of jelly beans out of the hands of a pers the audience. Holds them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The yellow number fives, red, green and purple dye you put in this here candy causes seven kinds a cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECURITY MAN approaches, Ron walks away from him. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 87

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The aspartame in my diet coke, the steroids in my meat, the hormones in my milk, the antibiotics in the chicken. Now that's the shit the FDA knows will kill you. Yet you're all up there worried that some sick people will find somethin' without you and y'all won't get paid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron throws the bag of jelly beans to the security man who catches it. And he leaves the room, squeaking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron is driving, singing out loud, a cappella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I'm bad, I'm nationwide!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sevard puts Ron's flyer down on the table in front of Eve stands in front of the medical board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We think it is in everyone's best interest that you resign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve looks at Dr. Sevard who meets her gaze with calculate coldness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't.    You'll have to fire me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to leave, stops, turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all go fuck yourselves!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron appears from the kitchen with a beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're splitting that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron cracks the beer and hands her the can. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 88 RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a ballsy move! Eve looks away.   Ron opens his arms... RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nice, warm hug... (she accepts it) ...and a day of watchin' some bull ridin', that's what you need, doctor Woodroof's order. She smiles and they both let go, uneasy with the closenes RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you miss a regular life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Regular?     What's that?   Doesn't exist. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess. (a beat) I just want... Ron looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? He takes the can back. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... an ice-cold beer at Ruby's. Go dancin' with my woman. I want kids... thumb wrestle with my sons. I don't know. I got one life -- mine. But I want someone else's. I feel I'm fighting for a life I ain't got the time to live. Ron downs some beer. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want it all to mean somethin'. Eve looks at Ron, studies him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 89

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve looks at the painting of the Texas Wildflowers. For s reason, she becomes emotional and decides to straighten i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Ron's box of meds, almost empty. By the look on face, Ron clearly just woke up. But there is something el He takes an empty bottle of Peptide T and looks at it, confused. Hears the strange ringing again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that is all we hear as we see Ron driving along the s into the middle of an intersection. Ron stops the car, pu his hands over his ears, and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron tries to direct traffic, bear foot. People blare thei car horns. Others scream out their windows. A POLICEMAN arrives on the scene and approaches Ron. Tucker pulls up and sees Ron, he jumps out of his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take care of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker steps in.   He grabs Ron's arm, makes eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron! You are in the middle of the street. Do you understand what I'm sayin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer from Ron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, man, let's go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker puts a hand on Ron's shoulder and walks him toward squad car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLUE BOX rests on the table, next to Ron who stares at as he's being given an injection of Peptide T by Tucker. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 90

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker's father sits in a chair facing Ron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I remember you, trouble maker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still am!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you're doin' better, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna talk with Ron a minute, pop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker steps off to the side with Ron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, the FDA is gonna bust you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron's wheels are turning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the tip, Tuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as Ron exits the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be there, man, and don't you fuckin' hit me again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A line of customers is out the door as three Dallas Polic Cars pull up. As Tucker gets out of the lead car, he is greeted by Richard Barkley and two FDA Agents. They head inside. That's Ron's POV...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as he's watching from a window. Eve tends to several buyers club members, I.V.s attached them, lying on the floor. A NEWS TEAM films the entire thing. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 91

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the reporter) This is Fluconazole. It helps them with Thrush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the front door OPENS.   Police are in the room, drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one move. Put your hands in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The news camera keeps rolling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronald Woodroof?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron steps up through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a warrant for your arrest, a search warrant for the premises, and a court order to cease and desist business immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, Ron allows Tucker to handcuff him. And as does, the Customers "Boo" and "Hiss" loudly, all caught o the News Crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn off that camera. Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the Camera Man doesn't stop filming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ron) Please instruct the rest of these people to leave, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't no cop.    Why'nt you tell 'em?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker escorts Ron outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The News Crew continues to film as Ron is led out past th waiting Customers, talking to the reporter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the bust of the century! Don't they look like hardened criminals?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 92 An ambulance pulls up. MEN wearing MASKS and GLOVES begin escort people off. Barkley and his Agents watch the circu from the sidewalk. Ron is put in the Squad Car by Tucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David Wayne enters and throws a NEWSPAPER on the table in front of Ron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deadly drugs? What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wrote the FDA's story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe it.   I tipped those assholes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I got good news. I got you a change of venue for the Peptide T trial in San Francisco. And no surprise, they're not pressing charges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what the fuck am I doin' here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're trying to break you, I don't know. Let's get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) They'll never break me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Ron's reflection in the window of a cab that moves of the way as Ron starts walking towards the Courthouse, helped by David Wayne who holds his arm. A SUPER fades in. U.S. District Court Northern District of California Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 92

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron, dressed in a conservative suit, is looking extremely Next to him is David Wayne and two other younger ATTORNEY On the opposing side are FDA representatives including Ri Barkley and others who we haven't ever seen before. They a team of four attorneys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The constitution, specifically the ninth amendment, does not state that you have the right to be mentally healthy or physically healthy. It does state that you have a right to chose your own medical care but that is interpreted as medical care that is approved by the Food and Drug Administration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Judge looks over to the FDA table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Regarding the FDA, the court is highly disturbed by its bullying tactics and direct interference with a drug whose own agency has found to be non-toxic. The FDA was formed to protect people, not prevent them from getting help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Judge sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The law does not seem to make much common sense. If a person has been found to be terminally ill they ought to be able to take just about any drug they feel will help... but that is not the law. Mr. Woodroof, there is not a person in this courtroom who is not moved to compassion by your plight, what is lacking here is the legal authority to intervene. I'm sorry. This case is hereby dismissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Judge bangs the gavel. David Wayne raises in frustration.   Ron closes his eyes, defeated. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 93

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron, still looking sick, opens the door and is startled b crowd of people clapping and cheering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Mother Mary Fucking Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Among the crowd, Ron spots Eve and David Wayne with a smi victory on their faces. Ron doesn't understand. They walk him and show him a paper with the FDA logo on it. Black. Super: Following the trial, the FDA in Washington allowed Ron to Peptide T for his own personal use.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as the cheering and clapping grow bigger, we cut to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron, 20 pounds heavier, looking healthier, is sitting ato railing above the stall looking down at the bull. He's go gloves, hat, pants, and boots, ready to ride. He removes flask from his pocket and takes a long swig. The BULLHAND Ron exchange a look. Ron nods, takes a deep breath, swing his legs over the railing, straddles the stall, stays abo the animal. The moment Ron's ass hits the leather, the ga is up, the bull is out, and the crowd whoops it up. Rodeo contestant number "43" Ron Woodroof rides the bull, hands, legs and heels all working together. His "off" han held out above him, cutting the air for balance. The bull makes an abrupt change of direction, catches Ron guard and just when it seems that he's about to be thrown the air, we hear Eve screaming her guts out as the image freezes on a PERFECT FRAME on this cowboy in action to co the beast. The crowd's CHEERS are echoing in the distance, blended w the soft strange ring that we know, that only Ron could h And as we zoom in on the image:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronald Woodroof died on September 12, 1992, seven years a was diagnosed with the HIV virus. He managed to stay aliv using unapproved drugs and was memorialized by 1000 gay m Dallas, Texas. Dallas Buyers Club / Green Revision / Dec 2, 2012 / P. 93

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fluconazole and Alpha Interferon are now FDA approved. DDC was approved in 1992 but is no longer used due to its highly toxic effects. Peptide T remains unapproved but still in studies for neurological diseases, like Alzheimer. Today, it is had been   scientifically proven that HIV is cause of AIDS. Based    on this knowledge, great strides been made in treating   this infection with anti-HIV medi but a cure has yet to   be discovered. The first studies with AZT as a single drug (monotherapy) while showing initial good results did not ultimately pro be a long term solution for HIV treatment. By 1996, medical researchers learned that HIV is best tre with a combination cocktail of at least three HIV medicat AZT was frequently used as a part of these early combinat therapies. Today, AZT has been largely replaced by safer, HIV medications.
